CITY OF NEW' YORK
MUNICIPAL BROADCASTING SYSTEM
yjL^
MUNICIPAL BUILDING
NEW yORK 1, N.y.
SEYMOUR N. SIEGEL
Director
WORTH 2-5600
JOHN DE PROSPO
Executive Officer
June 19, 1950
Mr. Richard B. Hull, President
National Association of
Xducational Broadcasters
WOI, Iowa State College
Ames, Iowa
Dear Dick:
I have your note of June 13th regarding
Willard C. Winchers. I am writing to him suggesting
that he make available a single copy of any special
program that might be available for distribution to
the NA3SB network. The Amsterdam Symphony sounds like
a terrific idea, but I have certain qualms in connection
with Mr. Petrillofs point of view on the importation of
foreign music. However, we got a clearance on the Canadian
Concerts, so it is entirely possible that we might be able
to do the same thing with the Netherland situation.
1 am dropping Ted Cott a reminder concerning BPM*
I do not know whether or not he is still in the publishing
business.
With all
SNSs cb
The Voice Of The City
